TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ResXFileRef extends System.Object
.class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit ResXFileRef extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a link to an external resource.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Resources.ResXFileRef> class is used to include references to files in an XML resource (.resx) file. A <xref:System.Resources.ResXFileRef> object represents a link to an external resource in an XML resource (.resx) file. You add the <xref:System.Resources.ResXFileRef> object to a .resx file by calling the <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.AddResource%28System.Resources.ResXDataNode%29?displayProperty=nameWithType> method.
In a data entry in a .resx file, the type is <xref:System.Resources.ResXFileRef>, and the value is the path location on disk. When the resource manager deserializes the object, the <xref:System.Resources.ResXFileRef> performs the I/O to get the file. The following is an example of a .resx file.
``` <data name="iconclip" type="System.Resources.ResXFileRef, System.Windows.Forms"> <value>lookout.bmp;System.Drawing.Bitmap, System.Drawing</value> </data> <data name="mailbackground" type="System.Resources.ResXFileRef, System.Windows.Forms"> <value>mailbackground.bmp;System.Drawing.Bitmap, System.Drawing</value> </data> <data name="xplogo" type="System.Resources.ResXFileRef, System.Windows.Forms"> <value>xplogo.png;System.Drawing.Bitmap, System.Drawing</value> </data> ```
To add a <xref:System.Resources.ResXFileRef> object to a .resx file programmatically, you call the <xref:System.Resources.ResXDataNode.%23ctor%28System.String%2CSystem.Resources.ResXFileRef%29?displayProperty=nameWithType> constructor to instantiate a <xref:System.Resources.ResXDataNode> object. You then pass this <xref:System.Resources.ResXDataNode> object to the <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.AddResource%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method.
When you compile a .resx file with [Resgen.exe (Resource File Generator)](/dotnet/framework/tools/resgen-exe-resource-file-generator), the resources specified in the .resx file are embedded in the resulting document resource file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The type referred to by the `typeName` parameter must support a public constructor that accepts a <xref:System.IO.Stream> object as a parameter.
